name: SIM

bibles.title: Banna New Testament
bibles.description: The New Testament in the Banna language of Ethiopia

language.name: Hamer-Banna
language.area: South Omo region, near Omo River; north of Lake Turkana, southwest corner, near Kenya, Uganda, Sudan borders.

bibles.title: Bariba Bible
bibles.description: The Holy Bible in the Baatonum language of Benin, also called the Bariba language

language.name: Baatonum
language.area: Central, north, Borgou Province. Also in Nigeria.

bibles.title: Boko (Benin) Bible
bibles.description: The Holy Bible in the Boko language spoken in Benin and Nigeria

bibles.title: Busa Bible
bibles.title_vernacular: Luda yã takada kũ Bisã yão
bibles.description: Portions of the Holy Bible in the Busa language of Nigeria

language.name: Busa
language.area: Niger state, Borgu LGA, Kebbi state, Bagudo LGA. 35 villages.

bibles.title: Bokobaru Bible
bibles.title_vernacular: Luda yã takada kↄ̃n Bokobaru yão
bibles.description: The New Testament and portions of the Old Testament in the Bokobaru language of Nigeria

language.name: Bokobaru
language.area: Kwara state, primarily Kaiama LGA, some in Baruten LGA. 35 villages.

bibles.title: Lokpa Bible
bibles.description: Portions of the Holy Bible in the Lokpa language of Benin

language.name: Lukpa
language.area: West Djougou and border areas, Atakora Province. Primarily Kémérida area. Also in Togo.

bibles.title: Fulfulde Borgu New Testament Portions
bibles.description: Portions of the New Testament in the Fulfulde Borgu language of Benin

language.name: Borgu Fulfulde
language.area: Atakora and Borgou provinces, villages, and encampments; Borgou region, Bakuure north of N’Dali; central and south Borgou region, Parakou area, Korakuure; north, Atacora region, Djougoure, from Djougou north to Burkina border. May extend west into north Togo; Tchabankeere in Zou region. Also in Nigeria, Togo.

bibles.title: Fulfulde Burkina New Testament
bibles.title_vernacular: Fulfulfe Burkina, Dewtere Laamɗo Amaana Keso

language.name: Western Niger Fulfulde
language.area: West, Burkina Faso border east to Dogondoutchi area. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso.

language.name: Gourmanchéma
language.area: East, Gourma, Tapoa, Gnagna, Komandjari, Yagha, and Kompienga provinces, below scrub land that blends into the Sahara. Also in Benin, Niger, Togo.

bibles.title: Kafa Bible
bibles.description: Translation of the Bible into the Kafa language using the dialect and script adopted by the government schools if the Kafa-speaking area. This is the first publication of the whole Bible; the New Testament published in 1999 has been revised in this publication.

language.name: Kafa
language.area: Kafa region, Bonga town area. May be some in Sudan.

language.name: Mabaan
language.area: Blue Nile and Upper Nile provinces border, between Yabus and Tombak rivers north and Khor Daga south.

language.name: Mokole
language.area: Borgou Province, Kandi and villages north and east.

bibles.title: Somali Bible (SIM)
bibles.description: The Holy Bible in the Somali language of Somalia, Adan Jim'ale Version

language.name: Somali
language.area: Widespread. Also in Canada, Djibouti, Ethiopia, Finland, Italy, Kenya, Oman, Saudi Arabia, Sweden, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, Yemen.

language.name: Kyanga
language.area: Kebbi state, Geshuru, Kaele, Saufu, and Tuni villages west of Illo; Boko villages of Maze, Samia, Baikinrua, Pisa. Also in Benin.

bibles.title: Uduk Bible
bibles.description: Uduk New Testament and OT Portions

language.name: Uduk
language.area: Gambela region, near Gambela town, Bonga, large refugee camp. Also in Sudan.

bibles.title: Wolaytta Bible (Latin)
bibles.description: Portions of the Holy Bible in the Wolaytta language of Ethiopia
bibles.description_vernacular: Xoossaa Na7aa ammaniya ubbai merinaa de7uwaa ekkanaappe attin, xayenna mala, Xoossai ha sa7aa keehi siiqido gishshau, ba mexi issi Na7aa immiis.

language.name: Manga Kanuri
language.area: East, along Nigeria border. Also in Nigeria.

country.name: United States
country.introduction: Britain's American colonies broke with the mother country in 1776 and were recognized as the new nation of the United States of America following the Treaty of Paris in 1783. During the 19th and 20th centuries 37 new states were added to the original 13 as the nation expanded across the North American continent and acquired a number of overseas possessions. The two most traumatic experiences in the nation's history were the Civil War (1861-65) in which a northern Union of states defeated a secessionist Confederacy of 11 southern slave states and the Great Depression of the 1930s an economic downturn during which about a quarter of the labor force lost its jobs. Buoyed by victories in World Wars I and II and the end of the Cold War in 1991 the US remains the world's most powerful nation state. Since the end of World War II the economy has achieved relatively steady growth low unemployment and inflation and rapid advances in technology.
country.overview: 'The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nation’s presence into the Pacific Ocean. Major Atlantic Coast cities are New York a global finance and culture center and capital Washington DC. Midwestern metropolis Chicago is known for influential architecture and on the west coast Los Angeles'' Hollywood is famed for filmmaking.'
